intro: Stillingia texana var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf stingingweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces striking red-orange flowers that are often surrounded by distinctive, waxy bracts. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a rough texture and a distinctive aromatic scent. Stillingia texana var. latifolia is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can cause skin irritation and other adverse effects.
